data.event: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan â€” Pakistan agreed Monday to reinstate a fired chief justice, a move that will help defuse a political crisis that has sparked street battles and raised fears of instability in the country at a time of surging Islamist violence.

event.title: later Monday until Iftikhar Mohammad Chaudhry, known

data.event: Opposition leaders and lawyers had vowed to sit-in at the parliament later Monday until Iftikhar Mohammad Chaudhry, known for his independence and willingness to challenge authority, was reinstated.
Gilani also ordered all lawyers and political activists arrested over the past week to be freed immediately.
Former President Pervez Musharraf fired Chaudhry, 60, in 2007 after he took up cases challenging the leader's rule, sparking a wave of protests that helped force Musharraf from power in 2008.
